spaceinvaders.server.network.tcp

Class TcpHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • spaceinvaders.server.network.tcp.TcpHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Void>, Service<java.lang.Void>

    public class TcpHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements Service<java.lang.Void>
    Listens for TCP connections.

    Handles the arrival and transfer of all sockets opened for incoming connections.

    All clients initially establish a TCP connection. TCP is used only for commands for which the arrival must be guaranteed and their order of arrival matters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TcpHandler

        public TcpHandler(int port,
                  java.util.concurrent.TransferQueue<java.net.Socket> socketTransferQueue)
           throws SocketOpeningException,
                  IllegalPortNumberException
        Parameters:
        port - the port on which incoming connections are expected to arrive.
        socketTransferQueue - a queue through which the newly open sockets are transferred.
        Throws:
        SocketOpeningException - if an error occurs while opening the server's socket.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the security manager does not allow an operation.
        IllegalPortNumberException - if the port number is not valid.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if an argument is null.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Close the socket used for listening.

        The handler will no longer accept incoming TCP connections.

        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Service<java.lang.Void>
